result.execSummary:
The defendant Ross A Adee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ross A Adee is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ross A Adee was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Ross A Adee was found guilty of Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Ross A Adee was found guilty of Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Ross A Adee was found guilty of Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Ross A Adee was found guilty of Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Count 3

Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: Count 3

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Sex offender assessment. Sex offender treatment. Sex offender registry. No contact with any minors. May not work or volunteer with any minors. May not possess any sexual explicit material. Access to the interent will be left at the discretion of the agent. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Conditions: ***AMENDED CRIMINAL COMPLAINT ATTACHED***   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours: Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.   No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). No minors and no internet use.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 10/29/2015:  No contact with any minor children.  No use of internet.  May not possess any weapons.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780), exceptions are attending court, meetings with his attorney or treatment programs that are verified.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.
Charges per attached criminal complaint.**
